headline: US still needs a 'strong manufacturing base': Bill Ford
summary: US automaker Ford (F) is coming out swinging with big reveals at the Detroit Auto Show, including the company's partnership with the Oracle Red Bull Racing team. Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian is joined by Ford executive chairman Bill Ford to talk more about the company's domestic manufacturing, electric vehicles, and the future of its Formula One racing partnerships. Ford is the great-grandson of the American auto company's founder Henry Ford and has previously served as chief executive of Ford. Also be sure to catch Yahoo Finance's most recent interview with Ford CEO Jim Farley and hear Carhartt CEO Linda Hubbard talk more about the workwear brand's partnership with the car company. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: F1: Max Verstappen talks 2026 season, the future, & more
summary: Ford (F) debuted its new car for the 2026 Formula One (F1) season, which kicks off in March. Max Verstappen, F1 race driver, chats with Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian to discuss expectations for the newest F1 season, his plans for the racing team he owns, and more. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Trump Says It's 'A Good Thing' Ford Has 5K Open Mechanic Jobs. 'You're Going To Have A Thing Called Robots'
summary: President Donald Trump shrugged off concerns about worker shortages during a visit to a Ford (NYSE:F) assembly plant on Tuesday, instead framing the 5,000 unfilled mechanic jobs as a sign of economic strength. “That's a good thing, Tony,” Trump told CBS News in an interview at the Dearborn, Michigan factory. “That means it's vibrant.” Trump Defends Tariffs, Touts Robots And AI Trump toured Ford’s facility, where gas and hybrid F-150s are assembled. He praised U.S. automakers and used the visit t

headline: Chinese EVs are making inroads in North America. That worries industry experts
summary: Chinese automakers have been making inroads around the world with growing sales of their high-tech, stylish and affordable electric vehicles.  Experts now say an easier path into Canada could be a big boost for Chinese carmakers looking to dominate the global market — particularly as their domestic market weakens — continuing to threaten other auto manufacturers, particularly American companies.  “This is telling us that Chinese automakers continue to be really popular, and are doing better and better, and not just something that’s sold in global markets that are more marginal or less important to U.S. automakers,” said Ilaria Mazzocco, deputy director and senior fellow with the Trustee Chair in Chinese Business and Economics at the Center for Strategic and International Studies.  What makes Chinese vehicles stand out?

headline: Carhartt CEO: Our value comes from workwear brand's 'authenticity'
summary: Workwear brand Carhartt is teaming up with American automaker Ford (F) to shine a headlight on the growing skilled labor shortage within the US manufacturing industry. Carhartt CEO Linda Hubbard speaks with Market Catalysts Anchor Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi about the brand's Ford partnership and the value of functional workwear for tradesmen. Also catch Linda Hubbard's comments on how skilled labor opportunities are largely going "unnoticed" in the US. Be sure to watch Yahoo Finance's most recent interview with Ford CEO Jim Farley. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Skilled labor is 'unnoticed' in US: Carhartt CEO on Ford partnership
summary: While Ford (F) warns of a shortage of mechanics and other skilled workers at its auto plants, the car company is partnering with workwear brand Carhartt as a means to promote opportunities in the manufacturing industry. Carhartt CEO Linda Hubbard sits down with Market Catalysts Anchor Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi to talk about how this partnership plans to shine a light on the opportunities in skilled labor jobs that are otherwise going "unnoticed" in the US. Also be sure to catch Yahoo Finance's most recent interview with Ford CEO Jim Farley. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Lithium-Ion Battery Market Projected to Reach US$ 864.91 Billion by 2035, Reflecting Structural Shifts in Global Energy Storage Demand Says Astute Analytica
summary: Solid-state advancements and circular recycling ecosystems will drive future growth, projected to double energy density by 2030. headline: 3 Stocks Under $50 We Approach with Caution
summary: The $10-50 price range often includes mid-sized businesses with proven track records and plenty of growth runway ahead. They also usually carry less risk than penny stocks, though they’re not immune to volatility as many lack the scale advantages of their larger peers.

headline: Tesla Model Y Emerges As Best-Selling EV In US For 2025 Despite 15% Drop In Q4 Sales — Ford F150 Lightning Edges Out Cybertruck
summary: Tesla Inc.'s (NASDAQ:TSLA) Model Y Crossover SUV emerged as the best-selling EV in the U.S. for 2025, despite a drop in domestic sales for the Elon Musk-led EV giant. Tesla Sales Dipped 15% New data released by Cox Automotive on Tuesday revealed that the Model Y sold over 92,460 units during the fourth quarter, with YTD sales standing at 357,528, making it the best-selling EV in the U.S. market.
